def.dt: :a permanent road having a line of rails fixed to ties and laid on a roadbed and providing a track for cars or equipment drawn by locomotives or propelled by self-contained motors
:such a road and its assets constituting a single property
:to convict with undue haste and by means of false charges or insufficient evidence
:to push through hastily or without due consideration
:an apartment having a series of narrow rooms arranged in line

def.set: probably from its dissemination by railroad
from the rows of luminescent spots along its sides making it resemble a lighted train
def.dt: :the larva or wingless female of any of several South American beetles (genus Phrixothrix of the family Cantharidae)
:a system of cooperation among active antislavery people in the United States before 1863 by which fugitive slaves were secretly helped to reach the North or Canada called also Underground Railway
